pullrequest.title: Learn Gazebo Visual Plugins for Ocean Reflections

content.raw:
When trying to integrate a very simple reflection with the original Gerstner Waves, I did the following steps:

`hg update default`

I then made the following change

```
diff -r 252e2f71c1b3 wave_gazebo/world_models/ocean_waves/model.xacro
--- a/wave_gazebo/world_models/ocean_waves/model.xacro  Thu Aug 08 23:27:45 2019 +0000
+++ b/wave_gazebo/world_models/ocean_waves/model.xacro  Tue Aug 20 17:02:09 2019 -0700
@@ -66,9 +66,10 @@
           </wave>
         </plugin>
         <geometry>
-          <mesh>
-            <uri>model://ocean_waves/meshes/mesh.dae</uri>
-          </mesh>
+          <plane>
+            <normal>0 0 1</normal>
+            <size>1000 1000</size>
+          </plane>
         </geometry>
         <material>
           <script>
@@ -94,9 +95,10 @@
           </wave>
         </plugin>
         <geometry>
-          <mesh>
-            <uri>model://ocean_waves/meshes/mesh_below.dae</uri>
-          </mesh>
+          <plane>
+            <normal>0 0 1</normal>
+            <size>1000 1000</size>
+          </plane>
         </geometry>
         <material>
           <script>
~
```

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/3508927371-image_2.png)
‌

Original

---

‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/BgXLzgM/images/417087477-image.png)
‌

After change 

---

The mesh currently used looks like a very simple plane. Is there any reason why this big change occurs? @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} , should we still replace the mesh with the plane?
